children.name: Prescribed Subject 3 All
children.description: All Questions in Prescribed Subject 3 Move to Global War

children.name: PS3.1 - Japanese Expansion
children.description: Nationalism & militarism, Japanese domestic issues, Manchuria, Pearl Harbor, League of Nations, international response

children.name: PS3.2 - German and Italian Expansion
children.description: Fascism & Nazism, economic issues, appeasement, Abyssinia, Nazi-Soviet Pact, and international responses

children.name: Prescribed Subject 4 All
children.description: All Questions in Prescribed Subject 4 Rights & Protest

children.name: PS4.1 - US Civil Rights Movement
children.description: African Americans, segregation, Jim Crow, non-violent protests, Civil & Voting Rights Acts, Martin Luther King Jr, NAACP

children.name: PS4.2 - Apartheid South Africa
children.description: Legislation, "classification" systems, Bantustans, defiance campaign, Sharpeville, Rivonia, Mandela, and key groups

children.name: Prescribed Subject 5 All
children.description: All Questions in Prescribed Subject 5 Conflict & Intervention

children.name: PS5.1 - Rwanda
children.description: Ethnic tension, Hutu power, colonial legacy, Rwandan Civil War, genocide, justice, the refugee crisis, and other impacts

children.name: PS5.2 - Kosovo
children.description: Ethnic tension, political issues, Milosevic, ethnic cleansing, international response, refugee crisis, and other impacts

children.name: WH Topic 8 All
children.description: All Questions in WH Topic 8 Independence Movements (1800-2000)

children.name: WHT8.1 - Origins & Rise to Independence
children.description: Relative importance of nationalism, political ideology, religion, race, social & economic issues, wars and other factors

children.name: WHT8.2 - Methods Used & Reasons for Success
children.description: Violent & non-violent methods used, importance of leaders and other factors in success of independence movements

children.name: WHT8.3 - Challenges & Responses in First 10 Years
children.description: Political problems, ethnic, racial, and separatist movements, social & economic challenges, and responses

children.name: WH Topic 10 All
children.description: All Questions in WH Topic 10 Authoritarian States (20th Century)

children.name: WHT10.1 - Emergence
children.description: Economic, social, political, and other factors influencing emergence and methods to establish control

children.name: WHT10.2 - Consolidation & Maintenance of Power
children.description: Methods to consolidate and maintain power, treatment of opposition, and impacts of foreign policy on power

children.name: WHT10.3 - Aims & Results of Policies
children.description: Domestic policies on economy, society, culture, women, and minorities, extent of authoritarian control

children.name: WH Topic 11 All
children.description: All Questions in WH Topic 11 20th Century Wars

children.name: WHT11.1 - Causes
children.description: Economic, ideological, political, and territorial causes including short- and long-term causes

children.name: WHT11.2 - Practices & Their Impact on Outcome
children.description: Types of war, technological developments, mobilization of resources, influence of foreign powers

children.name: WHT11.3 - Effects
children.description: Peacemaking, territorial changes, political impacts, economic & social impacts including changes for women

children.name: WH Topic 12 All
children.description: All Questions in WH Topic 12 The Cold War

children.name: WHT12.1 - Rivalry, Mistrust, and Accord
children.description: Breakdown of the Grand Alliance, role of ideology, containment, superpower relations, detente, arms race

children.name: WHT12.2 - Leaders & Nations
children.description: Impact of leaders on the Cold War & impact of the Cold War on countries around the world

children.name: WHT12.3 - Cold War Crises
children.description: Causes, impact and significance of Cold War crises around the world

children.name: Regional Option 2 All
children.description: All Questions in Regional Option 2 History of the Americas

children.name: A13 - World War II and the Americas
children.description: World War 2 and its impacts: diplomacy, the Good Neighbor policy, treatment of women & minorities, and atomic weapons

children.name: A16 - The Cold War and the Americas
children.description: Cold War in the Americas: Truman, McCarthyism, the Korean War, Eisenhower, Vietnam, Kennedy, Johnson, Nixon and Carter

children.name: A17 - Civil Rights and Social Movements
children.description: Social movements post-1945: indigenous, African American, feminist, Hispanic America and youth movements in the Americas

children.name: Regional Option 3 All
children.description: All Questions in Regional Option 3 History of Asia and Oceania

children.name: AO14 - The Peopleâ€™s Republic of China
children.description: China under the CCP, role of Mao, the Cultural Revolution, foreign affairs, post-Mao power struggle and changes

children.name: AO15 - Cold War Conflicts in Asia
children.description: Cold War conflicts in Asia: Malayan Emergency, Korean War, Vietnam, Cambodia and Afghanistan

children.name: Regional Option 4 All
children.description: All Questions in Regional Option 4 History of Europe

children.name: EU12 - Imperial Russia and the Soviet Union
children.description: Tsarist Russia and its eventual collapse, the revolutions of 1917, the Civil War and Lenin's rule

children.name: EU13 - Europe and World War I
children.description: Short- and long-term origins of World War I, diplomacy, foreign policy, alliances, nationalism and the arms race

children.name: EU14 - Inter-war Domestic Developments in Europe
children.description: Domestic developments in Germany, Italy, Spain and one other country in the Inter-war years
